current_subquestions: Q1: Identify the pattern in the input grid that is being mirrored in the output grid.
new_subanswers_ys: A1: The pattern in the input grid that is being mirrored in the output grid is a vertical reflection of the non-zero elements. The non-zero elements in the input grid are reflected vertically to the other side of the grid in the output grid. The reflection is done around the center of the grid.

A2: The rule for the transformation is to reflect the non-zero elements vertically around the center of the grid. The position of the non-zero elements in the output grid is the mirror image of their position in the input grid.

A3: We can apply this rule to the quiz input grid by reflecting the non-zero elements vertically around the center of the grid. The non-zero elements in the quiz input grid are at positions (2,6), (8,3), (9,1), (9,2), (9,3), (9,4), (10,1), (10,3), (10,4), (10,5) and (10,6). Their reflected positions in the output grid will be (7,6), (1,3), (0,1), (0,2), (0,3), (0,4), (0,1), (0,3), (0,4), (0,5) and (0,6) respectively.
